name: Free-Fi.Org
body: ### **NEVER** use open unsecured WiFi. EVER. [Identity theft](https://www.fbi.gov/about-us/investigate/cyber/identity_theft) is one of the fastest growing crimes. If you use a wireless network Wi-Fi that does not use a password, [your private information can be stolen by anyone](http://dilbert.com/strip/2015-06-21). ### Use "Free-Fi" as the default password Most WiFi modern networks today can offer **WPA2** security, which means that even if the password is public, then other people can not access your data. (Note: A dedicated hacker MAY be able to steal your session on initial connection, but this is still safer than NO password). If you go to a hotel or coffee shop that has an open and unsecured WiFi, then please ask them to set a password. The suggested default password for all wireless networks should be **"Free-Fi"**. This means the wireless network is participating in "Free-Fi" and users should abide by the [TERMS][http://www.Free-Fi.Org/Terms] of use. ### Free-Fi patent I filed for a provisional patent that would allow anyone to automatically connect to and open wireless networks SECURELY. ### About Ric Johnson Software developer manager, inventor, scuba diver, sky diver, open source contributor * Winner 2015 [INTRAPRENEUR innovation](http://leadership-labs.org/) award * Inventor of the world's first DVR - [Free.TV](http://bit.ly/freeTVpitch) * Founder of [NoSQL.Com](http://bit.ly/NoSQLPitchDeck) - the API to BigData * Founder of [OpenDomain](http://OpenDomain.Org) , a non-profit that give domains to Open Source groups or charities ** [Ecmascript](http://www.ecmascript.org/) ** [OpenAjax](http://www.openajax.org/OpenDomain.php) ** [XMPP (Jabber)](http://xmpp.org/xsf/press/2005-12-30.shtml) ** [Drupal](http://www.opendomain.org/success-stories/drupal-press-release/) ** [FOSDEM](https://archive.fosdem.org/2008/sponsors.html) ** [OSCon](http://www.oscon.com) ** [Google Schema](https://schema.org/docs/faq.html#17) ** [W3C - WebPlatform](http://www.webplatform.com/) /play inconceivable Follow @jsON
